alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 3:28PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING ALONG THE NORTHERN BRISTOL BAY COAST INCLUDING NUSHAGAK BAY... Gale force south to southwesterly winds will peak through late this afternoon into the evening hours as a strong storm system continues moving northeastward between Bristol Bay and Kuskokwim Bay. The strong southerly winds will result in elevated water levels with the potential for ice compression along south and west facing shorelines. The greatest chance for elevated water levels and ice compaction is expected to be along the Northern Bristol Bay coast between Togiak and Naknek. Water levels are expected to rise above normal highest tide with the highest water levels expected this evening before slowly subsiding late tonight. Residents with interests along the coast should move items well above the normal high tide line.
